metadata.Title: CVE-2015-5950 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The NVIDIA display driver R352 before 353.82 and R340 before 341.81 on Windows; R304 before 304.128, R340 before 340.93, and R352 before 352.41 on Linux; and R352 before 352.46 on GRID vGPU and vSGA allows local users to write to an arbitrary kernel memory location and consequently gain privileges via a crafted ioctl call.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5950` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libcuda1-304 - 304.128-0ubuntu0.0.1
nvidia-304 - 304.128-0ubuntu0.0.1
nvidia-current - 304.128-0ubuntu0.0.1
nvidia-libopencl1-304 - 304.128-0ubuntu0.0.1
nvidia-opencl-icd-304 - 304.128-0ubuntu0.0.1
No subscription required

libcuda1-304-updates - 304.128-0ubuntu0.0.1
nvidia-304-updates - 304.128-0ubuntu0.0.1
nvidia-current-updates - 304.128-0ubuntu0.0.1
nvidia-experimental-304 - 304.128-0ubuntu0.0.1
nvidia-libopencl1-304-updates - 304.128-0ubuntu0.0.1
nvidia-opencl-icd-304-updates - 304.128-0ubuntu0.0.1
No subscription required

libcuda1-331 - 340.93-0ubuntu0.0.1
libcuda1-340 - 340.93-0ubuntu0.0.1
nvidia-331 - 340.93-0ubuntu0.0.1
nvidia-331-uvm - 340.93-0ubuntu0.0.1
nvidia-340 - 340.93-0ubuntu0.0.1
nvidia-340-uvm - 340.93-0ubuntu0.0.1
nvidia-libopencl1-331 - 340.93-0ubuntu0.0.1
nvidia-libopencl1-340 - 340.93-0ubuntu0.0.1
nvidia-opencl-icd-331 - 340.93-0ubuntu0.0.1
nvidia-opencl-icd-340 - 340.93-0ubuntu0.0.1
No subscription required

libcuda1-331-updates - 340.93-0ubuntu0.0.1
libcuda1-340-updates - 340.93-0ubuntu0.0.1
nvidia-331-updates - 340.93-0ubuntu0.0.1

nvidia-340-updates - 340.93-0ubuntu0.0.1
nvidia-340-updates-uvm - 340.93-0ubuntu0.0.1
nvidia-libopencl1-331-updates - 340.93-0ubuntu0.0.1
nvidia-libopencl1-340-updates - 340.93-0ubuntu0.0.1
nvidia-opencl-icd-331-updates - 340.93-0ubuntu0.0.1

libcuda1-346 - 346.96-0ubuntu0.0.1

criterions.comment: nvidia-graphics-drivers-304 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '304.128-0ubuntu0.0.1').
nvidia-graphics-drivers-304-updates package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '304.128-0ubuntu0.0.1').
nvidia-graphics-drivers-310-updates: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
